alert.note: Alert for Clark (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 8:26PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Oregon, Benton, Clackamas, Linn, Marion, Multnomah, Polk, Tillamook, Washington and Yamhill. In southwest Washington, Clark. * WHEN...Until 400 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor urban flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 818 PM PST, observed rain amounts over the past 24 hours generally ranged between 1 and 3 inches, causing small stream flooding and flooding in low lying urban areas and/or areas with poor drainage. - Additional rainfall amounts between 0.25 and 1.0 inches are expected over the advisory area Sunday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
